pull.title: Demo merge of libsecp256k1 and deterministic signing

events.message:
Do signature-s negation inside the tests

To avoid the need for libsecp256k1 to expose such functionality.

Squashed 'src/secp256k1/' content from commit ef6f677

git-subtree-dir: src/secp256k1
git-subtree-split: ef6f677679d7c2a5ba7d3ad85da0456a1d086a3e
Do not use EC code in global constructors
build: fixup configure to not export anything
build: secp256k1 as a subdir, since it's required

revert part of 9eda1620b

This probably would've broken native OSX builds

events.body: This is just to show that libsecp256k1's deterministic signing (#5220) and the OpenSSL-based deterministic signing (#5227) are compatible with eachother, so switching between them will not change the signatures produced (and the tests from #5227 remain useful).

rename.from: Demo merge of libsecp256k1 and determinsitic signing
rename.to: Demo merge of libsecp256k1 and deterministic signing

events.body: Closing this as I'm not going to keep both #5220 and this one up to date. I'll rebase #5220 and #5227 as necessary.
